intro: Delissea puberula, commonly known as the hairy delissea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Delissea puberula is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
